author: Mark Chapman
comment: Atlas doesn’t track exercises regardless of claims. Training exercises works most of the time by the exercise cannot be determined even when a custom workout has been laid out. Any notification will Freeze/ Crash the app during a workout. Used the app for 3+ months and it’s never tracked an exercise correctly during the exercise used the app for mostly tracking what exercises I had planned to perform.  I’ve also been in contact with their support because the directions on setting up the app and training exercises were poor. I’m using the LG Watch Urbane. I cannot recommend the app

author: Andrew Morris
comment: Horrible ui, can't add sets only exercises and reps, can't add exercises that you don't want auto tracking but want rest counter and manual rep and weight input. Cant modify number of reps and weight used on the fly either, only add missing. Long way to go on this app, 'exercise tracker' is much better, atlas could do with following its ui and usability.

author: John Lee
comment: Promising but needs a lot more polish. Frequent crashes on my moto 360 gen 2 watch. Improperly identifying exercise, not recognizing an exercise at all, and complete app crashing happens regularly.

author: Till Luge
comment: I really like this application. Unlike the one other app that claims to be able to recognize movements, this one really does. I even bought the full version. However, while the website states that the app supports heart rate monitors, this is the case only for those built into watches, not for chest straps. This should be properly stated. Thus only 4 stars from me for now.

reply.author: Atlas Wearables, Inc.
reply.content: Hey Tim, thanks for the review. We support the built in optical heart rate monitors in Android wear watches if your watch has the hardware!

title: Love it, but...

author: Abdulrahman Alhazmi
comment: needs to be updated, almost a year out of date

author: Alvic Paje
comment: UPDATE 11/2/16 - The developer has been very responsive and is working with me on the issues I was experiencing.  I'm happy to report the crashing has gone away on my LG Urbane 2nd Edition LTE, but there are still some issues with duplicate entries and reps not being recognized.  I will try some tips from Atlas on how to improve the detection.    I'm very excited about this app since there really isn't any other app like it on Android Wear.  There are a lot of workout trackers for phones, but for the growin

reply.author: Atlas Wearables, Inc.
reply.content: Hi Alvic, Sorry to hear about your experiences. We're aware of & working on the crashing. Reach out to support@atlaswearables.com to join our beta.

author: Seth Black
comment: Tracking works well on my ZenWatch and I really like the analytics I get from each workout like rest time and muscle groups activated.
title: Awesome

author: Michael Kasparian
comment: Tracks my strength workouts, runs and guides me through what to do at the gym, all at the wrist. Also syncs to a web dashboard with amazing analytics! Really helpful to step my lifting game up and tone up!
title: Love it

comment: Useless in its current state for Huawei watch. Wildly inaccurate for counting reps of simple exercises, and registers reps for exercises that are not even close to the motions that I'm currently doing. Constant crashes on the Huawei watch, fails to sync properly on a regular basis, and heart rate monitoring is way off. App will also not recognize custom exercise motions, making it impossible to teach it motions from scratch.  If possible, I would like a refund. Was very excited to hear of the features and functionality of this product, but poor execution makes this disappointing.

reply.author: Atlas Wearables, Inc.
reply.content:
Sorry to hear about your experiences. The heart rate monitor is highly dependent on the smartwatch's sensor, we've had good luck with the Moto360 Sport. 

You can also teach Atlas exercises (see here for how: https://youtu.be/t0nRcp1jD5o). 

Crashing issues should be fixed with the latest release!

author: Aaron Walker
comment: What I liked: Watch interface easy, nice stats, heart rate monitoring during workout, standalone app.   What i didn't like: Phone interface poor, tracking poor, added additional exercises I couldn't remove which caused incorrect stats, caused full watch crash when a notification came through while tracking, phone supports metric, wear app only supports lbs, inconsistent...

reply.author: Atlas Wearables, Inc.
reply.content:
Sorry to hear! We've just released an update to make sure your preferences get synced, and are working on resolving crashing issues. Reach out to support@atlaswearables.com to join our beta.

To improve tracking, check out our help page: https://goo.gl/WT42x9
and how to add/remove exercises: https://goo.gl/qXkOCm

title: On the right track, but not there yet...

author: jond76
comment: Loaded up some freestyle exercises and it tracked perfectly. These folks really pulled of some magic here. If you want to ditch your sweaty paper gym log, grab this.
title: Just like its big brother

author: abhishek malik
comment: I am not able to add any exercise... Also it crashes several times on wear.... The mobile app isnt smooth.... Watch also heats.... Need several improvement...i tried mailing but no reply

reply.author: Atlas Wearables, Inc.
reply.content: Hey Abhishek, we've since resolved many stability issues and have reached out to you via e-mail. Would love to hear if you're having better luck with the app now!

title: Poor

comment: Difficult to use, UI sucks... No Abs exercise, don't have a clue how it works or learn any exercise. Wasted my money... Thanks God I did not buy the watch...

reply.author: Atlas Wearables, Inc.
reply.content:
Hi! Sorry to hear about your experience with the UI – would love to learn more so we can improve, reach out to us at support@atlaswearables.com.

We have many ab exercises including sit-ups, bicycle crunches, and more. You can also teach Atlas to track any repetitious motion that we don't already have by pressing the + button on the exercises page.
